page.title: 01CASTLE HILL
page.content: The farm on Castle Hill is 1900 years old.The kings men went to Castle Hill farm when the original Domesday Book was being written to ask the farmer questions.Castle Hill once had a roman villa,also 1900 years old.As well as the roman villa there was a saxon burial ground.In roman times there was a man called Paul the Chain if he asked someone there religon and they werenÂ£t a Jew he would kill them on the spot. Nowadays the farm is owned by Mr Greaves.The farm has 450 acres altogether.134 ewes,224 lambs and 150 beef cows.Mr GreavesÂ£s biggest field is 140 aches.Mr Greaves mostly grows corn,barley and rye.He owns 22 fields altogether.From the top of the hill you can see Cuddesdon Brook and Coombe Wood.
